correlation.title: PnL vs Number of Trades Correlation
correlation.label: Correlation
correlation.rSquaredTooltip: The coefficient of determination (R²) measures the strength of the correlation between the number of trades and PnL. R² close to 1 indicates a strong correlation, R² close to 0 indicates a weak correlation. The regression line shows the general trend.

drawdown.title: Daily Drawdown
drawdown.label: Drawdown
drawdown.tooltip: This chart shows the distance from your best level (peak). The line at 0 represents your peak. The higher the value, the further you are from your best level. When you reach a new peak, the drawdown returns to 0. Percentages (%) represent the percentage of loss from the peak. For example, 10% means you have lost 10% compared to your best level.

heatmap.title: Performance by Day of Week and Hour
heatmap.tooltip: This heatmap shows your performance (PnL) by day of the week and by hour. Each cell represents the total PnL for a day/hour combination. Blue colors indicate gains, pink colors indicate losses. The more intense the color, the higher the value. Only hours with data are displayed, with one hour of context before and after.

pnlDistribution.title: PnL Distribution
pnlDistribution.label: Percentage of trades
pnlDistribution.tooltip: This chart shows the distribution of your PnL (profits and losses) by grouping trades into value intervals. Each bar represents a PnL interval and its height indicates the percentage of trades that fall within that interval. This helps identify the most frequent PnL ranges in your trading.
